A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The critics are reviewing this movie in a sci-fi vacuum and not part of a beloved franchise. It is very shiny and has a few \"woo-hoo\" moments which are enough to please a critic or a \"loyal Star Wars fan\". Real Star Wars fans\, who are angry about this movie\, saw poor story telling which is inconsistent with past Star Wars stories. De-inventing the tractor beam to have a drawn out space chase was bad enough\, but disgracing Luke via dubious and out-of-character choices was the deal-breaker. While half the movie-goers did like the movie\, they were not hurt by their hero randomly changed into seemingly a different person for no reason other than to justify a a hack writers plot. The people that like this movie\, the so called \"loyal fans\"\, would happily watch a turd get flushed for 2 hours as long as the toilet had the words \"Star Wars\" on the seat. Real Fans hold their beloved IP to a higher standard.
